name: Bridge
description: A strategic bridge provides essential transportation across obstacles, offering access and trade routes, but the chokepoint nature makes it a target for control and attack. The transportation focus provides essential access and trade opportunities, while the strategic position makes it vulnerable to both natural disaster and military action. Additionally, a structure spanning a waterway provides essential transportation and trade routes, while creating strategic chokepoints. the bridge allows safe passage in all weather, while the construction represents significant engineering achievement and investment.
atmosphere: Stone arches span rushing water below while travelers and merchants cross on foot and horseback. The bridge connects distant shores with solid engineering as water echoes beneath. Toll booths and guard posts control strategic crossings. Weather-worn stone shows centuries of use.
